DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Yoga Aromatherapy Salivary Hormone Immune Function Pregnant Women .
DOC.detailed_description: This longitudinal , prospective , randomize control trial recruit 75 healthy pregnant woman prenatal clinic Taipei use convenience sampling . The participant randomly assign aromatherapy group ( n=25 ) , yoga group ( n=25 ) control ( n=25 ) group use Clinstat block randomization . The aromatherapy group receive 70 minute aromatherapy massage biweekly 20 week ; yoga group participate two weekly 70-minute yoga session lead midwife certify yoga instructor 20 week ; control group receive routine prenatal care . All participant ' salivary cortisol immunoglobulin A level collect yoga aromatherapy every 4 week 16 36 week ' gestation . To collect sufficient quantity saliva , use Salivette® cotton swab ( Salimetrics , State College , PA , USA ) , store double-layer plastic tube lid . When participant chew swab 2 3 minute , saliva flow stimulate sufficient amount ( 1 mL ) collection . After tube centrifuge 1000 x g 2 minute , saliva store -80°C assay salivary cortisol IgA concentration . Cortisol measure use competitive enzyme-linked immunoassay ( ELISA ) kit ( Cayman Chemical Company , USA ) , salivary IgA measure use double-antibody sandwich ELISA method per manufacturer 's instruction ( ICL , Inc. , USA ) .
